intro: Varronia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered varronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Varronia fasciculata is often found in humid, lowland areas and is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
